city:
Avarinth, the Hinge of Rivers, straddles three low granite isles where the River Sel breaks into a silver delta. The city is cinched by monumental tide-gates called the Hinges, iron-boned structures whose counterweights rise like ribs above the canals. At dusk, a thousand brass lanterns paint the mist in honey-colored halos, and the air smells of brine, saffron, and hot pitch from the boatyards. Bridges creak with the weight of market stalls; rooflines bristle with message-poles and weather-vanes carved as fish, knives, and crescent moons.

Avarinth is an engine of water and light. Its architects favor buoyant terraces and floodwise arcades, with stonework etched in wave glyphs and inlaid with slivers of mirrorglass. The city’s wealth flows through four crafts: tidewrighting (the precise art of taming currents), dye-lore (saffron, ochres, and moon-bitten pigments), optical alchemy (mirrorglass, lenses, and signal lanterns), and river trade (grain, basalt, amber, and ash). Inkroot, a marsh-grown tuber, is pulped into long-lived parchment, and Avarinth’s ledgers are famous for outliving the fortunes they record.

Government is a contest of lamps. The Lantern Parliament sits in a hall whose ceiling is a forest of chains from which hang ward-lamps and guild-lamps. When a vote is called, each faction lights its lamp with a tinctured flame, so the color of Avarinth’s law can be read from the street. The Parliament’s writ is tempered by the great guilds, whose contracts bind as tightly as any edict. Judges read not only statute but the knots in sanctified cords at the Basilica of Knotted Light, where oaths are literally tied and kept.

Avarinth was founded by refugees who fled the Shattered Weir of Sel three centuries ago, when the old river-dam broke like a jaw and drowned the upstream cities. The First Hinge was raised from scavenged stone and the rumored ribs of a river-drake that washed ashore; whether beast or machine, its bones still hum when storms roll in. The city survived the Night of the Unmoored, when a sabotage of the hinges loosed a black tide into the lower wards, and the Lantern Schism, when the Basilica’s Fifth Knot denounced the Parliament and was exiled to the Pilgrim’s Stair.

Today Avarinth thrives but leans on its margins. Silt is choking the northern channels, ash-fogs descend more often from the Ash-Veil Caldera, and whispers say glasswraiths prowl the Mirrorglass Conservatory’s oldest vaults. The Tidewrights’ Syndicate claims sovereignty over all hinges and canals, but the River-Marrows Guild runs the docks and knows every backwater. Merchants of the Saffron and Ochre Compact quietly buy lantern-seats one flame at a time. The Rookery of Whisper-Brokers owns the air above the city as surely as any guild owns stone. Avarinth’s light is bright, but bright light casts knife-sharp shadows.

surroundings.name: Glass Spine Ridge
surroundings.description: A serrated ridge of milk-quartz and obsidian shards thrusts from the earth like a broken comb, its facets catching dawn light until the whole spine glows. Wind along the ridge keens as if through a flute, and at night the shards ring with a thin, cold music.
surroundings.legend: When the sky-serpent Ilura fell in a storm of mirrors, her spine shattered across this ridge. The largest shard, the Mother Lens, is said to reveal not the future but the choice that would most break your heart.
hazards: blade-winds that can flense skin
mirror-lurkers drawn to reflections
rockfalls triggered by singing stones
dependencies: Mirrorglass Conservatory depends on ridge quartz for its finest lenses
Rookery uses polished shards as long-range signal panels
rumors: A vein of living glass slithers beneath the ridge, moving a finger-width each full moon
A Parliament envoy traded their true name to the Mother Lens to win a vote
hooks: Recover a stolen focusing prism before the Collegium’s equinox exhibition
Silence the ridge’s midnight music before it cracks the Lantern Parliament’s stained vaults

surroundings.name: Amber Fen
surroundings.description: A resin-soaked bog where cypress knees root in honeyed pools. Insects and even small birds hang in translucent amber bulbs the size of skulls. Reed-choked channels thread the fen, whispering as if they remember other voices.
surroundings.legend: The Fen remembers. Ancient songs are trapped in the amber along with flies and bones. Those who warm a lump against the skin hear verses of an empire that promised to never end and then did.
resources: amber for jewelry and ritual sealants
hazards: sudden sink-pools masked by leaf-scum
fen-wraiths shaped from reed and fog
amber fever that induces nostalgic hallucinations
dependencies: Basilica of Knotted Light uses fen-amber to seal oath knots
Inkroot Archives sources high-grade inkroot from guarded plots
rumors: A single amber bulb holds the throat of Avarinth’s first Speaker of Lamps
Fen-wraiths can be bargained with if you sing the right verse backward
hooks: Escort a procession harvesting consecration amber during the fog-tide
Find the reed-flute that calls the fen-wraiths off the trade canal

surroundings.name: Sunken Archive of Thren
surroundings.description: Beneath a blackwater lake lie marble stacks and drowned reading-rooms, their ceilings furred with algae and silvered fish. Stone librarians the size of oxen still patrol slow corridors, lanterns cold but eyes bright with patient duty.
surroundings.legend: The Archive sank in a single night when its curators tried to bottle a storm. The bottled wind escaped and hollowed the earth beneath them. They say the books still breathe, drawing water in and out through kelp-leather covers.
resources: waterproof vellum etched with breathing runes
lost treatises on hinge-craft and flood-law
labradorite tiles that glow when truth is spoken
hazards: pressure tides that can pin divers to ceilings
jealous library-constructs enforcing unread laws
ink eels attracted to bleeding wounds
dependencies: Inkroot Archives commissions salvage dives for flood-law precedent
Tidewrights’ Syndicate seeks lost hinge diagrams rumored in the western stacks
rumors: A Parliament amnesty writ lies sealed in a pearl-crusted reliquary on the lowest floor
One of the stone librarians remembers the true chords that wake a Hinge
hooks: Negotiate with a stone librarian for passage to the banned-shelf vault
Close a rift where bottled wind still hisses, drawing boats into the lake like moths

surroundings.name: Pilgrim’s Stair
surroundings.description: A switchback stair carved into a sea-cliff, slick with spray and crowded with prayer-niches. Midway, a spring burbles from a lion’s mouth, feeding cisterns that never run dry. On high feast nights, the stair is a river of candles.
surroundings.legend: Lights tied at the Stair answer questions if you ask them in tide-order: low, slack, high, slack. The Fifth Knot of the Basilica keeps vigil here, exiled until the lamps forgive them.
resources: limestone blocks etched with warding knots
hazards: wave backwash that can sweep pilgrims away
zealots policing questions deemed improper
slick algae making the sharpest turns deadly
dependencies: Basilica of Knotted Light draws holy water from the Stair
River-Marrows Guild maintains cliff-cobbles for safe passage
rumors: The Stair’s spring bubbles where a saint’s tears cracked the cliff
A hidden landing halfway down shelters smugglers under a shrine
hooks: Guard the Fifth Knot during a nocturnal reconciliation rite
Investigate vanished salt carts destined for the Basilica

surroundings.name: Ash-Veil Caldera
surroundings.description: A slumped volcanic bowl where ash hangs in veils that drift as if alive. Basalt flows form organ-pipes along the rim, and pumice fields crunch like bone underfoot. Sometimes the ash whispers back when spoken to.
surroundings.legend: The caldera’s ash remembers shapes. Old miners swear they have seen the faces of the lost walking the veils, guiding or misleading the living according to debts unpaid.
hazards: ash-choked gullies that smother the unmasked
ash drakes nesting beneath warm vents
sudden glass-ice forming on exposed skin
dependencies: Tide-Hinge Bastion was rebuilt with caldera basalt after the Night of the Unmoored
Ashen Wardens supply pumice to the Mirrorglass Conservatory
rumors: A vein of star-iron lies beneath a singing vent guarded by ash drakes
Ash veils can preserve a heartbeat forever if breathed at the right moment
hooks: Broker peace between Wardens and drake-tamers competing for the warm vents
Escort a basalt caravan through an ash-squall that erases tracks and time

surroundings.name: Moonfallen Orchard
surroundings.description: An orchard grown around a shallow crater where a moon-shard once struck. The fruit glows faintly at night; sap runs like quicksilver, and moths gather thick as lace. During the new moon, the trees lean closer to hear whispers.
surroundings.legend: The moon is said to have left a heartbeat here. Those who drink the sap on an eclipse hear their future lovers say goodbye.
resources: moon-resin used in lantern-flames and oath-cords
hazards: moth swarms that smother and steal breath
lunar vertigo that makes travel feel sideways
orchard-keepers who tithe blood for the trees
dependencies: Basilica of Knotted Light blends moon-resin into its knotted flames
Saffron and Ochre Compact refines lumenfruit into premium night-dyes
rumors: A second moon-stone lies buried beneath the oldest root and calls to thieves in their sleep
Lantern Parliamentors court in the orchard because the trees swear secrecy
hooks: Convince the orchard-keepers to sell resin during an eclipse truce
Hunt a moth-queen whose brood has dimmed the ward-lamps in Lowwater

surroundings.name: Shattered Weir of Sel
surroundings.description: Crumbling cyclopean blocks and twisted spillways rise from the river like the jawbones of a giant. Between the teeth, turbulent channels snarl and suck, and iron rings big as wagon-wheels bite into stone slick with moss.
surroundings.legend: They say a bound river-titan tried to swallow the sea and choked on its chains, breaking the old weir. In stormlight, some claim to see its tongue writhing beneath the foam.
resources: blueprints etched in waterproof slate sealed in weir-throats
rare eddies perfect for training hinge-craft
hazards: undertows that invert boats
chain-ghouls hunting by vibration
sudden drawdowns when the river remembers the old gates
dependencies: Tidewrights’ Syndicate tests apprentice crews in the Weir’s eddies
River-Marrows salvage iron and slate for Avarinth’s forges
rumors: A hinge-song etched in slate can wake a sleeping gate anywhere on the Sel
A Parliamentor’s heir vanished while walking the Weir at low storm
hooks: Map a safe salvage route through a newly opened weir-throat
Prove or debunk the rumor that the Weir still has a living heart

buildings.name: Tide-Hinge Bastion
buildings.description: A cathedral of hydraulics where counterweight towers flank an arched spillway. Brass walkways hang over roaring water, and great teeth of basalt slot down to tame the tide. Signal lanterns line the gantries, flaring green, blue, and saffron as crews call the dance of opening and closure.
buildings.history: Raised upon the bones of the First Hinge; rebuilt in basalt after the Night of the Unmoored. Its oldest foundations vibrate with a resonance that resonates with storms.
secrets: A sealed flood-culvert opens directly into the Parliament’s private canal
Basalt pylons are hollow and hold low-oxygen vaults used to store embargoed cargo
dependencies: Relies on basalt from Ash-Veil Caldera and chainwork forged of pre-fall iron salvaged at the Shattered Weir of Sel
Reads water with lenses ground at the Mirrorglass Conservatory
notable_figures: Syndic Orren Halv, Master of Sluices
Gantrix Pell, Signal-Mistress with a perfect ear for hinge-song
conflicts: Jurisdictional struggle with the River-Marrows over emergency closures
Sabotage attempts by smugglers who prefer flood-chaos to inspections
hooks: A hinge-tooth refuses to rise, humming in a way only a moon-flame can answer
A ghost-flood rehearses itself each dusk; find the echo that plays it

buildings.name: Hall of Many Lamps
buildings.description: A vaulted hall whose ceiling vanishes behind a hanging forest of lamps. Floors are inlaid with river-stone maps, and galleries smell of oil and saffron wax. Voices rise and fall like tides as clerks carry mirrored trays to capture official flames.
buildings.history: Founded after the First Hinge; briefly shuttered during the Lantern Schism when the Fifth Knot denounced its proceedings.
secrets: A mirror-lined listening passage runs behind the west gallery for the Rookery’s use
A crate of vote-lamps is filled with moon-resin fakes that burn backward
dependencies: Votes certified by knots from the Basilica of Knotted Light
Security coordinated with Tide-Hinge Bastion signal crews during crisis votes
conflicts: Ongoing bribery scandal involving dye futures and night-lamps
Dispute over who may carry flame into session: guilds or wards
hooks: Prevent a forged moon-flame from deciding a flood-tax
Expose the mirror-passage without collapsing talks with the Rookery

buildings.name: Basilica of Knotted Light
buildings.description: A ring of pale stone halls encircling a central well of lamps. Candles burn with differently tinctured flames: brine-blue for debts, saffron-gold for marriages, pearl-white for reconciliations. Priests weave corded knots that hold promises until untied.
buildings.history: Raised around a lantern said to have burned since the founding. The Fifth Knot was exiled to Pilgrim’s Stair after refusing to bless a wartime levy.
secrets: Some knots bind more than words; a lost sequence can still a heartbeat
Moon-resin knots hum when lies are spoken nearby, drawing moths
dependencies: Relies on moon-resin from Moonfallen Orchard and sanctified water from Pilgrim’s Stair
Purchases amber sealant from the Amber Fen
notable_figures: Rector Mera of the Ninth Knot
Exiled Prior Senne Vell of the Fifth Knot
conflicts: Tension with Parliament over the right to annul civic oaths
Quiet power struggle between Rector Mera and the returning Fifth Knot sympathizers
hooks: Unravel a cursed knot found fused to an oath-stone
Mediate a public untying where the cord refuses to release

buildings.name: Saffron Ledger Exchange
buildings.description: A circular market stacked in terraced galleries, each hung with cloths dyed in impossible gradients. A central ring of brokers cooks ledgers over braziers to seal deals with heat-reactive inks.
buildings.history: The Exchange rose on the fortunes of a caravan trust that broke the monopoly on night-dyes. It now underwrites half the lantern-seats in Parliament.
secrets: A hidden dye called Gloam bites into skin, marking oathbreakers to the bone
Ledger-weights contain shavings from the Mother Lens of the Glass Spine
dependencies: Night-dyes sourced from Moonfallen Orchard lumenfruit
Paper from Inkroot Archives’ mills and amber sealants from the Fen
notable_figures: Factor Lisi Jhak, who can smell the profit in a color
Seal-Master Dorn Vale, who never blinks at a loss
conflicts: Price war with independent dyers near Dyers’ Spiral
Accusations they fund hinge-sabotage to profit on flood insurance
hooks: Track counterfeit night-dyes that dim ward-lamps
Recover a stolen ledger-ember that burns invisible numbers into wood

buildings.name: Mirrorglass Conservatory
buildings.description: A spread of low, glass-roofed pavilions around a central prism-tower. Courtyards are tiled with mirrored mosaics that capture star-positions. Students in smoke-shaded goggles carry lenses wrapped like babies.
buildings.history: Founded by a breakaway from the Collegium of the far city of Vesk; the Conservatory fused practical optics with lantern-rhetoric and now drafts Parliament displays.
secrets: An underground vault stores a living pane of glass that reflects what it wants
Hallways bend light to hide doors in plain sight
dependencies: Quartz from the Glass Spine Ridge and pumice from Ash-Veil Caldera
Encrypted commissions from the Rookery for signal systems
notable_figures: Glassmaster Pel Korr, who says the city is a lens and people are light
Student Sav Orlai, whose shadow sometimes arrives late
conflicts: Dispute with the Rookery over who owns sky-signals
Charges of illusionary tampering with Parliament lamp-colors
hooks: Test a new lens atop the Hinge during a storm without shattering it
Find the shadow that left its owner and began spying

buildings.name: Rookery Spire
buildings.description: A narrow basalt finger stitched with balconies and netted aviaries. Trained rooks, crows, and mirror-kites roost in tiers while handlers knot message-cords and read reflected flashes from the ridge.
buildings.history: The Rookery began as a humble pigeon loft. It climbed with each scandal it carried, and now the Spire tops even the Parliament lamps.
secrets: A rook-clan has learned to mimic specific voices eerily well
A mirrored cistern under the Spire stores stolen reflections
dependencies: Signal mirrors tuned by the Mirrorglass Conservatory
Perch-rights negotiated with housetop clans
notable_figures: Mistress Caw, a handler who speaks better with birds than with people
Broker Thay Nerr, who buys secrets by the ounce
conflicts: Feud with the Mirrorglass Collegium over exclusive signals
Boatmen accuse the Rookery of selling patrol routes to smugglers
hooks: Decode a flurry of false signals that could trigger a hinge-closure
Escort a rook-clutch hatched with mirrored eyes to safety

buildings.name: Inkroot Archives
buildings.description: A rambling complex where millwheels turn inkroot pulp into parchment sheets and underground stacks hold cool, dry vaults. Brass dehumidifiers sigh like sleeping beasts.
buildings.history: Built on a siltbar that grows richer each year. Archivists decree knowledge should be waterproof after the drowning of Thren.
secrets: A forbidden shelf of tide-law contradicts Parliament charters
Archivist scribes can smell falsehoods in drying ink
dependencies: Inkroot from the Amber Fen and reclaimed vellum from the Sunken Archive of Thren
Security couriers from the Rookery
conflicts: Parliament demands access to sealed flood-writs; Archivists refuse
A mold blight spreads in patterns that match hinge-songs
hooks: Find the source of the mold-song before it eats flood-law
Smuggle a banned manual to a Tidewright without igniting a charter war

politics.name: Tidewrights’ Syndicate
politics.symbol: a knuckled gear encircling a droplet
politics.influence: controls hinge crews, flood schedules, and emergency closures
methods: technical vetoes applied through safety edicts
goals: codify absolute authority over all hinges and canals
recover lost hinge-craft from the Sunken Archive of Thren
seats: two copper lamps in the Lantern Parliament
edicts: no boat passes during Red Gale signals
all new quays must be hinge-rated
tensions: boatmen claim the Syndicate ignores livelihoods for textbook safety
plot_hooks: Broker a truce after a failed emergency closure drowns a grain fleet
Unmask a saboteur faking Red Gale signals to crash dye prices

politics.name: River-Marrows Guild
politics.symbol: a rope looped through a riverbone
politics.influence: dominates docks, pilotage, and salvage on the Sel
methods: cutting new backwaters to bypass tolls
rescuing boats to earn salvage rights
goals: win co-authority over hinge openings in trade hours
secure exclusive salvage charters at the Shattered Weir
seats: one smoky lamp in the Lantern Parliament
edicts: no cargo lifted by crane during slack-tide
tensions: suspected in a dock-fire that burned Parliament records
crew rivalries escalating into canal brawls
plot_hooks: Protect a pilot accused of cutting a forbidden backwater
Chart a new safe lane through silt that shifts with each moon

politics.name: Saffron and Ochre Compact
politics.type: merchant consortium of dyers and factors
politics.symbol: a coin stamped with a droplet in two halves: gold and rust
politics.influence: controls dye futures, fabric markets, and bourse credit
methods: patronage of ward festivals with free cloth
goals: monopolize night-dye refining from Moonfallen Orchard
install a permanent color-marshal in Parliament
rivals: Order of Knotted Light (over oath-dye use)
assets: secret formulae for gloam and dawnbreak dyes
seats: three bright lamps in the Lantern Parliament via proxies
edicts: standardize dye purity scales enforceable by fines
tensions: workers sickened by gloam residue seek redress
rumors of tampering with Parliament lamp-colors
plot_hooks: Investigate workers’ sickness tied to a new night-dye process
Expose a proxy network buying ward-lamps with hidden loans

politics.name: Order of Knotted Light
politics.symbol: a looped cord around a candle flame
politics.influence: sanctions oaths, mediates disputes, controls sacred knots
leaders: Rector Mera of the Ninth Knot
goals: reconcile the Fifth Knot and return them to the Basilica
assert veto power over Parliament laws that touch vows
rivals: Saffron and Ochre Compact (over dye-control of ritual flames)
seats: one pearl lamp in the Lantern Parliament
edicts: no oath may be sealed without witness and knot
moon-resin flames reserved for vows of life and debt
tensions: moth swarms drawn to moon-flames disrupt rites
plot_hooks: Escort Prior Vell to a clandestine parley with the Rector
Find who is tying false knots that bind beyond intent

politics.name: Mirrorglass Collegium
politics.symbol: a three-faceted prism with an eye at the core
politics.influence: shapes public spectacles, scrying, and surveillance optics
goals: perfect a lens that reads intent from light around the mouth
rivals: Order of Knotted Light (doctrine vs. truth-lens ethics)
assets: contracts with Parliament for official displays
quarry rights on Glass Spine Ridge
seats: one split lamp in the Lantern Parliament shared with allied scholars
edicts: ban masking cloths within a mile of Parliament on vote days
tensions: a living pane resists containment and imitates leaders
plot_hooks: Stop a truth-lens demo from outing protected informants
Negotiate mirror-rights before a festival devolves into flash-blindness

politics.name: Rookery of Whisper-Brokers
politics.symbol: a rook perched on a knot-post
politics.influence: owns aerial routes, message-cords, and rumor prices
seats: no formal lamp; three whisper benches behind the gallery
edicts: no signal without registry at dawn bell
tensions: accused of staging crises to heighten rumor prices
birds learning to improvise signals beyond handlers’ control
plot_hooks: Recover a stolen lexicon of bird-calls before a vote-night
Protect a whistleblower whose voice a rook now mimics

politics.name: Ashen Wardens
politics.symbol: a soot handprint over a volcano glyph
politics.influence: controls caldera access, basalt trade, and ash-craft rites
goals: secure Parliament protection for ash routes
seats: one ember-lamp in the Lantern Parliament
edicts: ash days require masks within two bells of the wind-change
obsidian blades licensed through the Wardens
tensions: quarry collapses blamed on Warden short-staffing
rumors of ash-rites that bind the dead to the veils
plot_hooks: Find proof that drake-tamers are stealing basalt under cover of squalls
Guide a Parliament delegation through a veiled court of ash-spirits

politics.name: Inkroot Archivists
politics.symbol: a reed pen crossed over a tide-mark
politics.influence: guards flood-law, records oaths, controls parchment supply
methods: seal-strings that fray when laws are altered
quiet embargoes on hostile factions’ paper
goals: compile a complete history of hinge-songs
assets: ink that browns when lies touch it
seats: no lamp; respected floor-rights during law readings
edicts: no law stands unarchived and unknotted
tensions: Parliament threatens to seize sealed writs on public safety grounds
a mold blight sings forbidden hinge-songs in the stacks
plot_hooks: Guard an archive procession carrying the original hinge-charter
Prove a critical flood-writ is a Parliament forgery replaced by a brown-ink copy
